name: Ronald Williams
title: Mineral Process Engineering Professional, Project Manager

contact.location: City of Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

professional_summary: Dedicated professional with extensive experience in chemical engineering, hazardous waste management, and process engineering. Served as a chemical engineering intern at the University of Stellenbosch, specializing in hazardous waste management, chemical storeroom management, and reverse osmosis plant maintenance. Engaged in research on mineral processing, e-waste processing, pyrolysis, and water purification. Authored technical reports on gravity separation using a Humphrey Spiral, heat transfer modeling with heat exchangers, ethanol-water separation via batch distillation, and bioreactor operations. Proficient in Mathematics, Organic and Inorganic Chemistry, Reactor Technology, Material Sciences, Particle Technology, Mass Transfer, Heat Transfer, Process Control, Optimization, Thermodynamics, Mineral Processing, Experimental Design, Numerical Methods, Scientific Report Writing, and Project Management. Skilled in problem-solving, presentations, operational oversight, environmental issues, and ISO standards.

academic_laboratory_experience.description: Investigated the Humphrey Spiral for separating magnetite from silica sand. Authored a report evaluating separation efficiency (85% magnetite recovery at 1.5 t/h feed rate, 10 L/min water flow), optimizing operational parameters, and addressing challenges like clogging at higher feed rates. Used XRF for sample analysis and applied principles from particle technology coursework.

Analyzed ball mill setups for particle size reduction; conducted smelting experiments in an arc furnace; separated minerals based on electrostatic properties; performed solid-state analysis using SEM-EDS, XRF, and XRD; analyzed sedimentation using camera imaging and MATLAB code; authored reports on mineral liberation and processing.
Generated a report on bioreactor operations; extracted DNA and cultured microorganisms on agar plates.

Modeled heat transfer with heat exchangers; conducted ethanol-water separation via batch distillation; performed experiments on heat conduction, convection, radiation, and mass transfer operations like crystallization and distillation.
Conducted organic, inorganic, and analytical chemistry experiments, including titrations, syntheses, and spectroscopic analyses (UV-Vis, FTIR).

Designed and simulated chemical reactors; performed experiments on reaction kinetics and control systems; modeled plug flow reactor (PFR) and continuous stirred-tank reactor (CSTR); applied experimental design and statistical analysis using MATLAB.
Conducted practicals on fluid dynamics, pump performance, specific heat measurements, and phase equilibria studies.
